articles.title: European stocks rise and commodities swing as markets face ‘energy supply shock’ - Financial Times
articles.description: Wall Street stocks rise after posting worst day since October 2020
articles.content:
Wall Street stocks climbed on Tuesday, while commodities remained volatile as traders weighed the prospect of disruptions to global supply chains stoked by Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

articles.author: Mark Thompson, CNN Business
articles.title: Europe could slash Russian gas imports this year - CNN
articles.description: Europe is planning to slash consumption of Russian natural gas this year as it prepares for a complete break with its single biggest energy supplier over the war in Ukraine.

articles.author: ABC News
articles.title: Xi Jinping calls for restraint in Ukraine, says China is 'pained' to see war reignited in Europe - ABC News
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping calls for "maximum restraint" in Ukraine and says China is "pained to see the flames of war reignited in Europe," according to state media, in his strongest statement to date on the conflict.
